PARAGRAPH.STRING: is the highest mountain in the eastern Alaska Range. Despite not being a fourteener,

is one of the largest peaks in the United States in terms of rise above local terrain. For example, the Northeast Face rises 8,000 feet (2,440m)in approximately 2 miles (3.2km). In terms of topographic prominence,
is one of the top 75 peaks in the world.

was first climbed in 1941 by Bradford Washburn, Barbara Washburn, Benjamin Ferris, Sterling Hendricks, Henry Hall, and William Shand, via the North Ridge.Today's standard route is the East Ridge (Alaska Grade 2+).
is not frequently climbed due to
remoteness and the resulting access difficulties.
